sentences.english: The mechanic did a quick and dirty repair on my car.
sentences.chinese: 那个机械师潦潦草草地修了我的车。

sentences.english: I guessed that the crude, scribbly letters had probably been written by a little boy.
sentences.chinese: 我猜，这拙劣潦草的字母很可能出自一个小男孩之手。

sentences.english: I looked at the 1)scrawled handwriting on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 我看着信封上潦草的字迹。

sentences.english: Your handwriting is so illegible that nobody can read it.
sentences.chinese: 你的字太潦草，谁也认不出来。

sentences.english: Three close, love mental efforts is gauntly, hurt vitality greatly, china female illegible marry a person.
sentences.chinese: 三分三合，爱得心力憔悴，大伤元气，华女潦草嫁人。

sentences.english: He is sometimes slipshod in handling his sources .
sentences.chinese: 他在处理资料来源时有时有点潦草。
难以辨认的潦草的笔迹。

sentences.english: When words are written carelessly, showing no respect, this shows my state of mind has not been well.
sentences.chinese: 如字写的潦草不恭敬，就会表示自己的心地不正常。

sentences.english: His handwriting is too spidery to read.
sentences.chinese: 他的字迹太潦草很难辨认。

sentences.english: It's getting harder to read my scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我潦草的字迹越来越难辨认。

sentences.english: His name was scrawled on it in an unfamiliar hand.
sentences.chinese: 一个陌生的笔迹在上面潦草地写下他的名字。

sentences.english: Can accurately identify the scribbled with pen words, l support the inverted pen inserted.
sentences.chinese: 可以精准地辨认潦草的连笔字，支持倒插笔书写。
比尔潦潦草草地给我写了个便条。

sentences.english: He wrote me a scribbled letter before leaving.
sentences.chinese: 他临行前给我写了一封字迹潦草的短信。

sentences.english: Inside the box was a letter written in simple scrawl.
sentences.chinese: 笔盒里放着一封用稚气的潦草笔迹写的信。

sentences.english: That kind of easy explanation won't fly for me. Tell me the details.
sentences.chinese: 这种浮皮潦草的解释是不行的，告诉我具体的内容。

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
to put pen to paper/pen mark
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
